column5: Just keep heading north. Wolloston Lake or Lake Athabaska are hard to beat. Bring money. Or south. Long Lake in the fall is nice too. There are a lot of northerns in Sask. Good luck.
Wollaston lake is outstanding, but expensive. Check out Minor Bay Camp.
www.silsbylakelodge.com Best trophy pike lake i know of

Athabasca - our group (4 of us) caught 15 40" + pike in 4 days. We also went into a bay that had "smaller" ones in the 25" - 35" range where you caught them literally every 3rd or fourth case. At one point on that bay I had action on 12 straight casts. The lake trout fishing is also incredible - I caught one in the 40 pound range. We stayed at Blackmur's. Very pricey though - kind of a once in a lifetime thing for most of us...
